benchmark_details.name: Kitchen-R
benchmark_details.overview: Kitchen-R is a benchmark that unifies the evaluation of task planning and low-level control within a simulated kitchen environment, featuring more than 500 complex language instructions and enabling holistic benchmarking of language-guided robotic agents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the Kitchen-R benchmark is to provide a unified testbed and baselines for robust agents that can execute complex language commands in realistic environments.

data.source: A digital twin simulated kitchen environment generated using Isaac Sim.
data.annotation: Automatically generated from templates based on kitchen scenes.

methodology.calculation: EM is calculated as the average of correctly predicted steps of plans, MSE is the average distance between predicted and expert trajectories.
methodology.interpretation: A high EM score indicates good performance in planning, while low MSE reflects high accuracy in trajectory prediction.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through data collection and evaluation during the Embodied AI track of the AIJ Contest.
